item.title: Body Local

item.description:
Toward the end of 2010 we worked on an identity project for BodyLocal, a NYC based fitness search engine. This post is a quick play-by-play of how their logo was created.

item.content:encoded:
We just wrapped up the identity and web design for Body Local, a NYC based fitness search engine. They’ll be covering everything in the world of fitness, nutrition, and wellness.

Homepage Design

Search Results Page Design

bodylocal.com

item.title: Spring O’Brien
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished re-designing this site for a Manhattan Ad Agency. We tied together a lot of different coding technologies to make a site that has a content management system (WordPress) but still has the interactive feel of a flash site.

The post Spring O’Brien appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
Spring O’Brien is a PR and media relations agency based in Manhattan. We re-designed their outdated flash website to modernize the look and feel and enable them to manage the content by adding a CMS.

The more we work with WordPress as a CMS the more we like it and the more things we figure out how to do with it. One of the things we learned on this project was using WordPress with Ajax… Without nerding out too much, Ajax is basically a coding technique that lets you bring new content into a web page without re-loading the page, which makes a HTML site feel more like a flash site.

Don’t hide things that are important

Another feature of the site (if you can call this a feature) is a consistent navigation. It’s always tempting to consolidate navigation in a dropdown, but rarely is it necessary or beneficial to the user. Spring O’Brien’s old site had everything buried in one drop down, so the navigation wasn’t taking up any space, but as you went from page to page you had to keep expanding the menu, which got redundant. The bigger problem though is that it made it hard to find the navigation at all since it was so nicely hidden in the design as one small word that said ‘menu’.

The post Spring O’Brien appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Wine Flirt
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We’re working with RSY Partners to re-think the WineFlirt site and make it better. This site turned out to be one of our favorite projects of last year. Viva el vino!

The post Wine Flirt appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We’re working with RSY Partners and WineTwoThree on Wine Flirt, a site to educate you on el mundo vino in a fun laid back way – no wine snobs here.

The post Wine Flirt appeared first on mimoYmima.

item.title: Atlantic Television
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
Website Design & Development This job was a collaboration with a bloke from the UK named Ian. He came up with the identity and we turned it into a website. We were web dev partners with Atlantic for years, helping them evolve their site and later made another site for them called ATV creative.

item.title: BrightRED Pixels
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We designed the v.1 website for our friends at BrightRED Pixels, a new media company in Manhattan. We tried to keep it simple with just two points of focus: content and company identity, so of course the design was very bright and very red, check it out: brightredpixels.com

The post BrightRED Pixels appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We designed the v.1 website for our friends at BrightRED Pixels, a new media company in Manhattan. We tried to keep it simple with just two points of focus: content and company identity, so of course the design was very bright and very red, check it out:

item.title: Laura Schair Photography
item.dc:creator: Brent Lagerman
item.description:
We just finished designing a full set of print collateral for Laura Schair, a well known NYC based wedding photographer. Offset Printing This is our second big print job in a row (see Weidenbaum Development). We’ve been working with Nobel Printing in Manhattan and really love the attention to detail they give to their work, […]

The post Laura Schair Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
item.content:encoded:
We just finished designing a full set of print collateral for Laura Schair, a well known NYC based wedding photographer.

Offset Printing

This is our second big print job in a row (see Weidenbaum Development). We’ve been working with Nobel Printing in Manhattan and really love the attention to detail they give to their work, working on-press with an offset printer is really exhilarating. They treat their work like an artform and you can really feel the history when you walk around their shop.

The post Laura Schair Photography appeared first on mimoYmima.
